text: The African Union and its Member States cannot protect & promote the culture of human rights in Africa alone. The African Commission on Human and Peoples’ Rights is mandated to ensure all citizens enjoy the rights contained in the African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights. This entails ensuring States do not violate these rights & if they do,the victims are reinstated in their rights.  https://t.co/wNwOHqWuTi

The special rapporteurs play a very significant role by researching, gathering and documenting information on these areas of human rights. This information is used by the Commission to formulate advice to African States. For more information, visit-  https://t.co/KhQZB4NHFc

Did you know… The African Commission on Human and Peoples’ Rights has Special Rapporteurs on Prisons and other places of Detention in Africa, on Arbitrary, Summary and Extra-judicial Executions, and on the Human Rights of Women in Africa?  https://t.co/N82aLuYiMW

Nhopi is a delicious Zimbabwean porridge like dish made mainly with pumpkin, butter squash, mealie meal, and peanut butter. Its perfect for breakfast, lunch or brunch. Share with us your favourite dish from #Zimbabwe #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Ifinkubala commonly known as Mopane Worms is a Zambian delicacy eaten as a snack or served with Nshima. They are boiled & fried in a pan with tomato, salt, onion & are a great source of protein. Share with us your favourite dish from #Zambia #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Nsenene grasshoppers are a Ugandan delicacy and a rich source of protein. Nsenene is a seasonal specialty dish fried in their own fat, without cooking oil and flavoured with onions and salt. Share with us your favourite dish from #Uganda #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Kamounia is a beef and liver stew prepared with cumin. This dish is a staple of Tunisian cuisine Share with us your favourite dish from #Tunisia #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
The celebration of #AfricaDay on 25 May 2022  https://t.co/jLeYXed2HI

Akoume is a traditional Togolese corn flour that is typically served as an accompaniment to other dishes fish, vegetables and meat stew. Share with us your favourite dish from #Togo #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Mchicha is a traditional dish in Tanzania. The vegetarian meal is prepared thick and creamy with leafy vegetables such as amaranth or spinach. Share with us your favourite dish from #Tanzania #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Moukhbaza is a delicious local cuisine in Sudan. It is made of banana paste or mashed bananas, lemon juice and hot chili peppers. Share with us your favourite dish from #Sudan #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Shaiyah a dish from South Sudan can be made with lamb, beef or goat meat and is typically made for special occasions. Share with us your favourite dish from #SouthSudan  #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Seven colours is a traditional South African meal that includes rice, chicken or beef, and sides such as pumpkin, sweet potatoes, beetroot, cabbage, beans salad, potato salad and coleslaw. Share with us your favourite dish from #SouthAfrica #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Sabaayad is a traditional flat bread from Somalia made with flour and cooked on a hot griddle. The bread can be eaten for breakfast, lunch, dinner or just as a snack. Share with us your favourite dish from #Somalia #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Saka-saka or Pondu is a well-liked delicacy in Sierra Leone made from cassava leaf and coconut. Its most typically served with  potato and rice. Share with us your favourite dish from #SierraLeone #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Chatini requin as known as Satini rekin, from Seychelles is made of mashed shark meat. This Seychellois delicacy is served cold accompanied by shredded green papaya, rice, and lentils. Share with us your favourite dish from #Seychelles #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Thiébou yapp is a delicious Senegalese stew made with a mix of rice, meat, and vegetables. The dish is served on a plate with the rice on the bottom, topped with meat and vegetables.  Share with us your favourite dish from #Senegal #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Calulu de Peixe from SaoTome & Principe is made with fresh or dry fish, shrimps okra, eggplants. It is accompanied by rice or funje a creamy cassava porridge. Share with us your favourite dish from #SãoToméandPríncipe #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Meifrisa is a traditional Saharawi stew that can be made from camel, goat, lamb, or rabbit. Share with us your favourite dish from #Saharawi #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Isombe is a Rwandan stew made from mashed cassava leave. It is served with rice. Share with us your favourite dish from #Rwanda  #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Gbegiri soup or abula from Nigera is made from peeled cooked black-eyed peas or honey seeds. It’s served with amala dudu (black yam flour), garri(ground cassava). Share with us your favourite dish from #Nigeria  #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Dounguouri soko is a popular stew from Niger made from a combination of lamb, white beans, bell peppers, tomatoes, onions. Share with us your favourite dish from #Niger  #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Oshifima is a Namibian staple made with mahangu flour and cornmeal. it served with different sauces.  Share with us your favourite dish from #Nambia #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Matata stew from Mozambique is made with a combination of chopped clams (or other shellfish), ground peanuts or peanut butter. Share with us your favourite dish from #Mozambique #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Loubia is a Moroccan dish that consists of stewed white beans in a delicious, flavourful tomato sauce. Share with us your favourite dish from #Morocco #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Roti Chau is a flatbread that's filled with rougaille (tomato-based sauce) and butter bean curry known as gros pois. Share with us your favourite dish from #Mauritus #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Fakoye is a plant based sauce from Mali and is eaten with rice and mutton. Share with us your favourite dish from #Mali #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Nsima is the staple food in Malawi. It’s a thick porridge made out of maize flour and water. Typically, eaten with vegetables and a protein—like usipa, beans, or meat. Share with us your favourite dish from #Malawi #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Did you know that Romazava was once a special dish for the Malagasy ruler?  It's a soup made of meat or chicken mixed with vegetables. Share with us your favourite dish from #Madagascar #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Bazeen is a popular dish in Libya made from barley and served with Hassa soup made with dried meat. Share with us your favourite dish from #Libya #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Those who eat #PILAU would like to know......which country has the best #JOLLOF ??? #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Dumboy made from Cassava flour served with vegetables meat or hot pepper soup is Liberia's national dish. Share with us your favourite dish from #Liberia #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Nyekoe a dish from Lesotho is made with a combination of beans, sorghum, pumpkin, oil, salt, and pepper. Share with us your favourite dish from #Lesotho #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Mutura is a popular #Kenya delicacy stuffing of goat intestines with a combination of ground meat, goat blood, and seasonings such as ginger, garlic, coriander, and pili-piri chilies. Share with us your favourite dish from #Kenya #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

The “Caldo de Mancarra” (Mancarra Stew) is one of the most well-known traditional dishes of Guinea Bissau cuisine. The dish consists of Chicken with Peanut Stew. Share with us your favourite dish from #GuineaBissau #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Yétissé is a delicious traditional stew from Guinea that is usually prepared with fish and served with rice combined with mashed okra. Share with us your favourite dish from #Guinea #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Omotuo is a Ghanaian staple food made from boiled rice which is stirred into small balls and served with peanut sauce. Share with us your favourite dish from #Ghana #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Ebbeh is a traditional soup from The Gambia. This chunky soup is made with vegetables. Share with us your favourite dish from #Gambia #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Did you know poulet nyembwe is Gabon's national dish? The dish consists of smoked chicken cooked in sauce graine or palm nut butter. Share with us your favourite dish from #Gabon.  #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Misir Wat is an Ethiopian spiced red lentils stew, it is served warm and usually accompanied by injera flatbread on the side. Share with us your favourite dish from #Ethiopia #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Ligusha a vegetable from Eswatini is very rich in fiber, protein and vitamin C. The dish is normally served with starchy staples such as pap or rice. Share with us your favourite dish from #eSwatini  #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Shahan ful is a traditional Eritrean dish that is typically served for breakfast. The dish is made by slowly cooking fava beans.The dish is especially popular during Lent & Ramadan Share with us your favorite dish from #Eritrea #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Did you know one of the most famous dishes in Equatorial Guinea is made with forest snails? it’s usually served with cassava or plantain. Share with us your favourite dish from #EquatorialGuinea #AfricaDay #YearofNutrition

Did you know kushari or koshari is Egypt's national dish and a widely popular street food? It is a combination of rice, lentils, pasta and chickpeas. Share with us your favourite dish from #Egypt #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Ragoût de légumes aux poissons is a traditional fish stew in Djibouti and is made with a combination of fish fillets. Share with us your favourite dish from # Djibouti #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Fumbwa is a Spinach stew from The Democratic Republic of Congo. It is usually prepared with spices and peanuts. Share with us your favourite dish from #DRC #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Kedjenou is one of the most popular recipes in Côte d’Ivoire. It is cooked without water or oil and can be eaten with rice or attiéké Share with us your favourite dish from #CotedIvoire #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Muamba nsusu is Congolese stew prepared with a combination of peanut butter, chicken, chili peppers & palm oil. it is served with rice. Share with us your favourite dish from #Comoros #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Le Me Tsolola is traditional Comoros stew made of fried fish and meat with green bananas in a sauce of onions, tomatoes and coconut milk. Share with us your favourite dish from #Comoros #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Aiyash is a famous Chadian snack food. It is made of millet flour, sunflower seeds, silken tofu, salt and oil. It's served with various sauces. Share with us your favourite dish from #Chad #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Kanda is a delicious meatball dish made with ground beef& pumpkin seeds popular in the Central African Republic.  Share with us your favourite dish from  #CentralAfricanRepublic #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Ekwang (Ekpang Nkukwo) from Cameroon is made with Cocoyams (taro) wrapped in cocoyam leaves (taro leaves) then cooked with red palm oil and other ingredients. Share with us your favourite dish from #Cameroon #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Cachupa or Munchupa is the national dish of Cape Verde. The delicacy is prepared with with hominy, beans, vegetables and seasoned meats. Share with us your favourite dish from #CaboVerde #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Boko Boko Harees is a traditional Burundian dish. The delicacy is prepared with chicken, turmeric and bulgur wheat. It's a great recipe to feed a crowd on a rainy day. Share with us your favourite dish from #Burundi #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Riz Graz also known as fat rice is Burkina Faso's national one-pot dish rice stew cooked in peanut oil.  Share with us your favourite dish from #BurkinaFaso #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition
Dikgobe also known as Samp and Beans is a traditional Botswana dish made with sorghum & beans with added vegetables. Share with us your favourite dish from #Botswana #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Dekounoun Sounnou (seed sauce) from Benin is obtained from palm nuts. This sauce is eaten with Télibo a white or black corn paste. Share with us your favourite dish from #Benin #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Catatos is an Angolan delicacy, it’s made by frying caterpillars with garlic often served with rice.Did you know caterpillars have higher doses of protein Share with us your favourite #Angola dish  #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

Dolma is a traditional #Algerian cuisine. its vegetables stuffed with minced meat, cooked in a white sauce flavoured with cinnamon. Popularly eaten during Ramadan Share with us your favourite #Algeria dish #AfricaDay #YearOfNutrition

The successful operationalisation of #AfCFTA is centred on, among other measures, the development of an African payment & settlement system to facilitate trade and reduce the inefficiencies of cross-border payments and settlements. The upcoming STC will deliberate further.

Illicit Financial Flows remain a major drawback of financing for sustainable development in Africa. To develop sustainable economies, states must mobilise domestic resources, including strengthening the fight against graft and ongoing projects and initiatives to stem IFFs.

For the first time in over a century, the world is discussing international tax rules; the consensus will impact tax revenue in African countries. It is crucial to ensure the outcome benefits Africa. Focus has also been on challenges arising from taxing the digital economy.

The Specialized Technical Committee on Finance, Monetary Affairs, Economic Planning and Integration on "Securing Africa's Taxing Rights, Stemming Illicit Financial Flows & developing payment system for AfCFTA", is key to move towards building more resilient economies in 2021

Public Service and Administration shall protect its agents against all forms of threats, insults, harassment oraggression. Article 16 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Article 17 Public Service Agents shall have the right, within a coherent and harmonized pay system, to a just and equitable remuneration which corresponds to their qualifications, responsibilities, performance and tenure.#AfricanPublicServiceDay

Article 14 “Public Service and Administration shall not encourage or perpetuate discrimination based on origin, race, gender, disability, religion, ethnicity, political opinion or any other consideration.” #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Article 11 “Public Service Agents shall not occupy any position, engage in transactions, hold financial,commercial, material interest incompatible with their duties or responsibilities” #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public Service Agents shall declare their assets & income at the beginning, during and at the end of their service as prescribed in national laws & regulations. Article 13 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

States shall enact laws and adopt strategies to fight corruption through the establishment of independent anti-corruption institutions. Article 12 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public Service Agents shall on no account use their positions for political or personal gains. In all circumstances, they shall act with impartiality and loyalty. Article 10 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public Service Agents shall not solicit, accept, or receive directly or indirectly any payment, gift, donation, or reward in kind or cash, for services rendered. Article 10 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public Service Agents shall demonstrate integrity and respect all rules, values and established codes of conduct in the performance of  their duties. Article 10 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public Service Agents shall be required to perform their professional duties and show courtesy, integrity and neutrality in dealing with users. Article 9 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public  Service  Agents  shall  demonstrate professionalism,  transparency and impartiality in the performance oftheir duties. Article 9 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public Service and Administration shall facilitate the introduction of modern and innovative procedures and systems for the delivery of its services. Article 8 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public services shall be delivered in the most effective, efficient and economical manner, consistent with the highest possible standards. Article 7 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay  https://t.co/JGtXhZhaCc

Public Service and Administration shall make available to users information on procedures and formalities pertaining to public service delivery. Article 6 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public Service shall be organised to ensure easy access to adequate services and shall be organised to ensure that services are delivered closer to users. Article 5  African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration #AfricanPublicServiceDay

Public Service and Administration and its agents shall respect the human rights, dignity and integrity of all users. Article 4 African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration  #AfricanPublicServiceDay

On #AfricanPublicServiceDay download the African Charter on Values & Principles of Public Service & Administration from  https://t.co/qa3BjMEHqH  & learn about the principles for Africa’s public service sector & find out if your country has ratified the treaty.  https://t.co/exAWFff18R

#NoNameCampaign underlines that children whose births are not registered & who lack proof of their age are more vulnerable to marginalization, discrimination, abuse & associated protection risks such as child marriage, child labour, forced recruitment to armed groups &trafficking  https://t.co/T5ApDdzpDD

The #NoNameCampaign recognizes the urgency to reposition civil registration and vital statistics in Africa, to address the indignity of invisibility. The campaign is equally timely as concerns rise on the threat of birth registration rates falling behind amid #COVID19 pandemic

Registration at birth, is one of the key elements to accelerate access to a child-friendly justice system for all children. The #NoNameCampaign seeks to rally for the speedy implementation of commitments by AU member states, towards universal registration of children at birth.

Aligned with the commemoration of the Day of the African Child and under #DAC2020 theme “Access to a Child Friendly Justice System in Africa”, @_AfricanUnion and @UNICEF, have launched the #NoNameCampaign: For every child legal identity, for every child access to justice”.  https://t.co/eeSU27BR4F

Lors de #DAC2020 sous thème “l’Accès à des systèmes judiciaires amis des enfants en Afrique”, l’Union africaine et @UNICEF ont lancé la campagne #MonNomEstPersonne: accélérons les droits des enfants à une identité légale et l’accès aux services, dont la justice amie des enfants.  https://t.co/xrOCJekhAw

The #AfCFTA will look at the issue of International property rights and patents and how patents can help develop and promote #industrialgrowth in #Africa @MeneWamkele @AmbMuchanga @UNCTADKituyi @wto

The #AfCFTA Secretary General @MeneWamkele notes that there are strong linkages between #publichealth and #trade and working with @AfricaCDC will be key to implementing measures to manage #pandemics such as #Coronavirus in the context of  #AfCFTA @AmbMuchanga @UNCTADKituyi @wto

Fourth focusing on #AfricanWomen, #AfricanYouth and #SMEs to support their inclusion in the #AfCFTA including learning from mistakes made in #FreeTrade agreements in other regions around the world so that #AfCFTA benefits all not just large countries and #multinationals

Third establishing #AfCFTA regional value chains with member states by prioritising high potential sectors such  #agroprocessing #pharmaceutical, #automotive manufacturing etc so that countries focus on areas of speciality to improve productive capacity and boost economic growth

Second addressing issue of 3rd party goods and transhipment of goods which will be addressed in the #AfCFTA negotiations on Rules of Origin. Joint task force of #African customs authorities & senior #trade officials to work on rules of origin

The 1st ever #AfCFTA Secretary General @MeneWamkele who was sworn in today stated some of his his key priorities as he takes no his new role. First  Establishing the institutions of implementation of the #AfCFTA such as the Committee of Senior Trade officials

The #RCM2020 session will be held back-to-back with the sixth session of the Africa Regional Forum on Sustainable Development #ARFSD-6 in Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe, on 24 February, 2020. ARFSD-6 will take place from 25 to 27 February 2020.

#RCM2020 is expected to enhance appreciation of the significance and role of youth in implementing the #DecadeofAction, and concrete action-oriented recommendations for their effective engagement in accelerating the achievement of the #SDGs and #Agenda2063

One of the expected outcomes of #RCM2020 is enhanced awareness and appreciation of the @_AfricanUnion’s 2020 theme: “Silencing the Guns”, and concrete recommendations on support of the #UN Development System for the implementation of the African Union roadmap on the theme.

#RCM2020 seeks to leverage the #UN #DecadeofAction for the realization of the #SustainableDevelopmentGoals and Africa’s #Agenda2063. It’ll also deliberate on the @_AfricanUnion’s 2020 theme "Silencing the Guns: Creating Conducive Conditions for Africa's Development" @ECA_Official

The #SAATM provides for the full liberalisation of intra-African air transport services in terms of market access, and the free exercise of first, second, third, fourth and fifth freedom traffic rights for scheduled and freight air services by eligible airlines. 33rd #AUSummit

The Single African Air Transport Market #SAATM is a flagship project of #Agenda2063 which aims to ensure intra-regional connectivity between the cities of #Africa as an impetus to the continent’s #economic #integration and growth agenda. @au_ied @HEDrAbouZeid

The increased connectivity by #rail also aims to reduce transport costs and relieve congestion of current and future systems, further integrating and boosting #trade in #Africa. 33rd #AUSummit @au_ied @HEDrAbouZeid

The Integrated High Speed Train Network, a flagship project of #Agenda2063  aims to connect all #African capitals and commercial centres through an #African High Speed Train Network, thereby facilitating the movement of goods, services and people. @au_ied 33rd #AUSummit .....

The @_AfricanUnion  has approved the 2019 budget for the Union at a total of $681.5  million,of the total budget, $158.5M will go into financing the  operational budget of the Union. $249.8M to program budget while $273.3M  will finance Peace Support operations. #AUreforms

#Rwanda, #Kenya,#Ethiopia, #Djibouti, #Chad, #Guinea, #Sudan, #Congo, #Cameroon,#Gambia,#Gabon, #Cote d’Ivoire #SierraLeone & #Ghana are implementing the 0.2% levy. 23 other countries are at various stages of implementation.#AUreforms

"The momentum in the implementation of the 0.2% levy decision is very positive & in-fact, looking at the contributions to the peace fund using this mechanism,it is the highest we have had. Africa is taking full ownership of its development agenda" said @AU_KwesiQuartey #AUReforms

The AU Peace Fund is used to finance the AU’s peace and security operations. The Fund covers operational activities such as Mediation and Preventive Diplomacy, Institutional Capacity and Peace Support Operations. #AUReforms

The programme budget of the Union covers the execution of programmes approved by the Assembly:  https://t.co/ZMNv4eAhUq 1.Financing agenda 2063 flagship projects; 2.Implementation of directives & decisions from summits;  3.Maintaining continental response readiness for emergencies

The @_AfricanUnion operational budget is used mainly to finance the cost of running the Union, its Organs, Specialised Technical Agencies, its representational offices and agencies across the world. #AUReforms

The @_AfricanUnion member states are working towards funding 100% of the Union’s operational budget, 75% of the programme budget and 25% of peace support operations by 2021. #AUreforms @AuReforms learn more @  https://t.co/BtmOWVE7ma

8/12 L’intégration n’est pas une option, mais une obligation, un impératif ... Integration is not an option but an obligation, an imperative

7/12 Il existe une corrélation étroite entre le degré de prospérité d’une région&son niveau d’intégration ... There is a strong linkage between the level of prosperity of a region&its degree of integration
6/12 L’évolution du monde&nos exigences de développement imposent d’accélérer le rythme de l’intégration ... Global trends&our development needs require that we speed up the pace of integration
5/12 Le PCUA salue l’engagement du Président Issoufou en faveur de la ZLEC... The AUC hails President Issoufou’s commitment to the #CFTA

4/12 Malgré un riche foisonnement institutionnel, le commerce intra-africain reste faible: 16% contre 70% pour l’UE ... In spite of a rich institutional framework, intra-African Trade remains low: 16% against 70% for the #EU

3/12 L’intégration du continent est un rêve ancien - des pas importants franchis, mais en deçà de dos ambitions ... African integration is a long-held dream - important steps made but they fall short of our ambitions
